title: Russian activist describes the moment she was forcefully separated from her daughter
description: CNN's Isa Soares speaks with Anastasia Shevchenko, a Russian activist whose two-year house arrest kept her from being by her ailing daughter's side during her death.

title: Al Roker missed the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade for the first time in 27 years
description: Famed "Today" meteorologist Al Roker was recently hospitalized and had to miss this year's Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. His co-hosts Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb wished him a speedy recovery.

title: Elon Musk says he will begin restoring previously banned Twitter accounts next week
description: Elon Musk said Thursday that he will begin restoring most previously banned accounts on Twitter starting next week, in his most wide-reaching move yet to undo the social media platform's policy of permanently suspending users who repeatedly violated its rules.

title: Ukraine battles to restore power after Russian strikes leave 'vast majority' of people without electricity
Hear how parents were united with their infants from Russian orphanage
description: Project Dynamo founder Bryan Stern explains how the organization united parents with their infant children who were in a Russian orphanage during the war in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine raced to restore power a day after a barrage of Russian missiles targeted key infrastructure. In a Kyiv hospital, surgeons operated by torch light.
description: Ukraine raced to restore power across the country on Thursday, a day after Russia sent a new barrage of missiles to target critical infrastructure, resulting in the temporary shutdown of most of its power plants and leaving the "vast majority" of people without electricity.

title: Arrest warrant issued for friend of a North Carolina woman found dead while on vacation in Mexico
description: Mexican prosecutors have gotten an arrest warrant for the friend of a North Carolina woman who was found dead last month while on vacation in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico.

title: Keke Palmer says Amy Schumer is helping her prep for 'SNL' hosting duties
description: Keke Palmer is set to host "Saturday Night Live" for the first time on Dec. 3, alongside musical guest SZA.

title: The world's skinniest skyscraper is now complete — and its interiors are remarkable
description: The designers behind the world's skinniest skyscraper have just given fans of ultra-luxury living an early Christmas gift.

title: How a scoop by a little-known crypto site led to the fall of Sam Bankman-Fried and implosion of FTX
description: The staggering level of apparent deception staged by former crypto king Sam Bankman-Fried wasn't uncovered by government investigators or a major powerhouse financial news organization, such as The Wall Street Journal.

title: Colorado mass shooting suspect appears in court
description: The suspect in the Club Q shooting that left six people dead and more than a dozen injured in Colorado Springs, Colorado made their first court appearce via video conference. The court appearance and mugshot show just how badly they were beaten after witnesses took the suspect down.

title: E. Jean Carroll sues Trump for battery and defamation as lookback window for adult sex abuse survivors' suits opens in New York
description: Ex-magazine columnist E. Jean Carroll sued former President Donald Trump for battery and defamation under a new New York law that allows adults alleging sexual assault to bring claims years after the attack.

title: The Club Q shooting fits into an enduring US pattern of intimidating vulnerable groups where they congregate
description: A version of this story appeared in CNN's Race Deconstructed newsletter. To get it in your inbox every week, sign up for free here.

title: Reporter stunned after spotting NFL owner Jerry Jones in 1957 photo
description: A resurfaced photograph from 1957 pictures Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones standing with a crowd of White students blocking six Black students from entering North Little Rock High School in Arkansas. CNN spoke with Washington Post reporter Sally Jenkins who was part of the team that discovered the photo.

title: Dolly Parton celebrates Miley Cyrus's 30th birthday
description: Dolly Parton paid tribute to her goddaughter Miley Cyrus on her 30th birthday.

title: Iranian doctor asks if the West will stand on the 'right side of history'
description: As Iranians continue to take to the streets in protest against the regime, risking bullets and brutality, the international community is being called on to respond. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh spoke to an Iranian protester who urged the UN to take "concrete action" in response to the vicious government crackdown.

title: Ronaldo to begin World Cup campaign with Portugal after Manchester United departure
description: • 'The greatest sporting upset of all time': When the US beat England at 1950 World Cup

title: Ronaldo to begin World Cup campaign with Portugal after Manchester United departure
UN rights chief says 'full-fledged' crisis underway in Iran amid crackdown on protesters
description: Iran is in a "full-fledged human rights crisis" as authorities clamp down on anti-regime dissidents, according to the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Chief Volker Turk.

title: Newborn pulled from rubble after Russia strikes maternity ward
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports on the destruction of a maternity ward in Vilnyansk, Ukraine, which mirrors the attack on a maternity and children's hospital in Mariupol back in March.

title: 'Africa's COP' made some big promises. Here's how to deliver
description: The recently-concluded COP27 was dubbed the "African COP" -- with the continent center stage in the global effort to fight the causes and effects of climate change.

title: 'The greatest sporting upset of all time': When the US beat the 'giants' of England at the 1950 World Cup
description: On one side of the pitch was a team made up some of the biggest names in world soccer. On the other was a grave digger, a dishwasher and a postman. The result seemed a formality.

title: The Italian city where the houses are fit for royalty
description: It's the Italian city home to palaces so spectacular that they're UNESCO World Heritage sites. A city that was once home to so much wealth that the local aristocracy lived in environments literally fit for a king, and the place where Rubens began his great artistic career.

title: How football became a Thanksgiving tradition
Flossie, the world's oldest living cat, is nearly 27 years old
description: Flossie, at the age of almost 27 -- which is the feline equivalent of being 120 human years old, according to Guinness World Records -- has been crowned the world's oldest living cat.

title: 'Football is everything': How Portugal and Manchester City star Rúben Dias forged his winning mentality
description: Before anyone else has arrived, Ruben Dias is at Manchester City's training ground, ready to begin his day.

title: Flood of lawsuits expected as window opens for adult survivors to sue in New York for sexual abuse
description: Adult survivors of sexual abuse now can sue their abusers in New York -- even if the statute of limitations on their claims has expired -- under a state law that goes into effect Thursday.

title: Russia's State Duma passes amendments to 'LGBT propaganda' law
description: Russia's lower house of parliament passed in the third reading amendments to a law on so-called "LGBT propaganda" on Thursday, expanding liability to all ages.

title: Here's what's open and closed on Thanksgiving
description: Stores and businesses across the United States will be closed Thursday as Americans celebrate Thanksgiving — but it can be confusing to figure out what will remain open. Many stores that were once open on Thanksgiving have changed policy since the pandemic, shuttering for the day before Black Friday sales.

title: 'A catastrophe': Horde of Celtic gold coins stolen from German museum
description: A horde of ancient coins has been stolen from a museum in southern Germany, according to the Bavarian State Police.

title: With dreams of Mars, this young activist works for a greener future on Earth
description: When he was just 15, Kazumi Muraki created a small, portable device to capture carbon from the atmosphere. Seven years later, the Japanese chemist is researching how to convert this captured carbon into fuel.

title: Atlético Madrid doctor called upon to treat Pope Francis' knee injury
description: The head doctor at Spanish football club Atlético Madrid has been called upon by the Vatican to treat Pope Francis' knee injury.

title: Webb telescope captures first look at an exoplanet's atmospheric breakdown
description: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured a detailed molecular and chemical portrait of a faraway planet's skies, scoring another first for the exoplanet science community.

title: Turkey isn't the reason you're sleepy -- really
description: Do you believe in the holiday food coma?

title: Can an AI-powered insect trap solve a $220 billion pest problem?
description: Pests destroy up 40% of the world's crops each year, causing $220 billion in economic losses, according to the UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO). Trapview is harnessing the power of AI to help tackle the problem.

title: Family of soccer star Katie Meyer files wrongful death lawsuit against Stanford University after she died by suicide
description: The family of Katie Meyer, a star soccer player who died by suicide last spring, has filed a wrongful death lawsuit against Stanford University and several administrators alleging their actions surrounding a potential disciplinary action caused her "to suffer an acute stress reaction that impulsively led to her suicide."

title: Ukrainian President details series of Russian airstrikes that destroyed critical facilities across the country, dubbing it "the Russian formula of terror"
Ukrainian President Zelensky urges UN Security Council to support 'peace formula' following missile strikes
Opinion: Why Putin would want a truce
description: A truce now in the war in Ukraine would essentially spell victory for Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Why some Arabs are furious about Western coverage of the Qatar World Cup
description:
• A silent protest against FIFA by Germany's World Cup team
• Messi fronts up to Saudi defeat

title: China's Covid cases hit record as dissent grows over tough restrictions
Gucci creative director Alessandro Michele steps down
description: Alessandro Michele has stepped down as Gucci's creative director after almost eight years, a period that saw him help revive and transform the Italian label's fortunes.

title: Stories of Ukrainian resistance revealed after Kherson pullout
description: Two Russian soldiers walked down a street in Kherson on a spring evening in early March, just days after Moscow captured the city. The temperature that night was still below freezing and the power was out, leaving the city in complete darkness as the soldiers made their way back to camp after a few drinks.

title: New 'Avatar' film gets rare China release
description: The long-awaited sequel to director James Cameron's blockbuster "Avatar" will be released in mainland Chinese cinemas on Dec. 16, 20th Century Studios said on Wednesday.

title: Witness says Walmart gunman told her to go home
description: Though Jessie Wilczewski had only been working at the Chesapeake, Virginia, Walmart for a few days, her Tuesday night shift started like all the rest, with a routine team meeting in the break room.

title: Ex-Trump official on why he thinks Trump will lose in 2024
description: Former President Donald Trump's acting Chief of Staff, Mick Mulvaney joins CNN's Kasie Hunt to discuss the future of the GOP and possible 2024 Republican nominees.

title: 'Government killed my dad': Grieving son blames China's Covid lockdown for father's death
description: CNN's Selina Wang speaks to a grieving son who says his dad was unable to get medical aid and blames China's draconian, zero-Covid policy for killing him.

title: Vintage photos show underbelly of boom-era Japan
description: When celebrated photographer Greg Girard landed in Tokyo in April 1976, he expected to spend only a few days in the Japanese capital. At that time a "broke traveler" in his early 20s, he was headed to more affordable destinations in southeast Asia.

title: Hear Walmart shooting survivor's terrifying encounter with gunman
description: Jessie Wilczewski was an employee for only five days at Walmart in Chesapeake, VA, when a fellow employee opened fire in the store's break room. She recounts her horrifying experience to CNN's Erica Hill.

title: 'They were wasted': Resistance fighter vividly details how he killed drunk Russian soldiers
description: In a CNN exclusive, Sam Kiley speaks to Kherson resistance fighters that helped liberate the Ukrainian city from Russia.

title: Paramedic rushes to crash scene only to realize victim is her daughter
description: A paramedic who responded to a horrific crash and attempted to rescue two teenage girls was unknowingly treating her own daughter. CNN affiliate CTV reports.
